The Story of the Elder Avaṭa-phali
“The Lord, the thousand-rayed One,
self-arisen, unconquered,
having arisen from seclusion,
went out for his alms round.
Seeing him with a fruit in my hand,🔽I approached the Lord of men;
with a serene mind, joyful,
I offered the fruit.
For ninety-four aeons,
the fruit I offered then;
I do not recall a bad destination,
this is the fruit of offering the fruit.
My defilements were burned up,
I live without defilements.
Welcome indeed was it to me,
the Buddha’s instruction has been done.
The four analytical insights,
the Buddha’s instruction has been done.”🔽Thus the elder Avaṭa-phali recited these verses.
